incident_updates.body: The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating an issue in which our zones on a Free plan level are not able to use the "Under Attack" mode.
Further detail will be provided as more information becomes available.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is aware of and investigating an issue with D1 in which there is currently a low error rate for HTTP requests to customer databases.
Further detail will be provided as more information becomes available.

Cloudflare identified and resolved an issue with the WARP API component within Gateway. Performance and connectivity through Gateway may have been affected for some customers between approximately 18:20 and 18:40 UTC today.
After further investigation, we confirmed that there was no widespread issue affecting usage-based billing alerts. As a result, this incident has been canceled.

Cloudflare is currently experiencing issues processing alerts related to Billable Usage.

We will share an update as soon as this billing service returns to normal.

incident_updates.body: This issue is now resolved.
We have disabled the rule in question, and the rate of false positives is decreasing. We are monitoring.

Cloudflare has identified an issue with the managed ruleset "Apache Camel - Remote Code Execution - CVE:CVE-2025-29891" which is potentially causing false positives. Customers can disable this rule by setting Action -> Log in the Cloudflare Dashboard. Other WAF rules are unaffected. We are currently working on a fix for this issue.
This issue is now resolved.

We have identified the issue with short-lived certificates which are used for authentication in Cloudflared SSH and Access for Infrastructure SSH. This is causing logins to fail for these two application types. All other Access application types are not impacted at this time.

We have applied a fix for this issue and are currently monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating an issue where Cloudflared short-lived cert SSH and Access for Infrastructure SSH are experiencing elevated error rates for some customers.
